body: Another long day ended with a busy signal, and Robert Sorsaia said he was feeling a lot like the phone cord dangling from his mother's coffee table -- twisted in knots and hanging in midair. ''It's been hell since my father died,'' Mr. Sorsaia said. ''I just don't know what to do anymore,'' he said. ''My mother is starving, and no one out there
title: The Neediest Cases; Widow Receives an Answer to Her Call for Help

body: In a storefront campaign office in the heart of Bay Ridge, Brooklyn, Joanne Seminara's headquarters seemed to be bustling with energy on a recent warm afternoon. Copy machines were churning out information, family members were calling voters and volunteers were immersed in the busy work of a campaign. Ms. Seminara, who became the Democratic
title: In Brooklyn, A 2nd Effort To Unseat A Republican

body: The official number of deaths in the destruction of the World Trade Center stood yesterday at 201, and the medical examiner has identified only a few dozen victims; almost 5,000 are listed as missing. Those glimpsed on this page include six who have been confirmed dead: Bill Biggart, Pamela J. Boyce, Timothy Haskell, Joseph Lovero, Daniel W. McNeal
title: A NATION CHALLENGED: PORTRAITS OF GRIEF: THE VICTIMS; Parties, Love Notes and Other Small Memories That Now Loom Large

author: Kate Zernike is an education reporter for The Times.
body: Can the shape of a hallway discourage bullying in schools? Can more windows even out the gap between rich and poor students? Can a simple change of paint increase test scores, or carpeting make a math whiz out of the class clown? Researchers pooh-poohed such ideas for years, referring in particular to a 1997 study by the Educational Testing Service
title: The Feng Shui of Schools

body: A 9-year-old girl was rescued from the surf by lifeguards at Coney Island yesterday after she was apparently pulled under the water by a mild undertow, the authorities said. She was listed in serious but stable condition last night at Maimonides Medical Center in Brooklyn. The girl, Alice Chen of Dyker Heights, Brooklyn, had been playing in
title: Lifeguards Rescue Girl, 9

body: They have lived long enough for their days to be easy, yet on any given day Angelo Furio, 73, and David Heller, 80, are racing around Brooklyn in an old station wagon, making house calls as highly sought-after handymen. Getting a date with them can take weeks. Still, their clients speak their names with awe and adoration, in part because Mr. Furio
title: Elderly Volunteers Aid Homebound

body: WHEN Arturo Swayze talks about how he transformed a dump, it sounds easy, as if anyone could do it. Describing his technique for creating the new kitchen counter, something that wouldn't look out of place in a Tuscan farmhouse (or at least a showroom for people decorating Tuscan farmhouses) he says it was nothing. ''I just broke up tile and set it
title: Habitats/Dyker Heights, Brooklyn; Fixing Up a Fixer-Upper

body: When Arturo Swayze rented an apartment in Dyker Heights, he knew it needed work. He did it himself, including a new kitchen counter. By Trish Hall 4
title: Habitats/Brooklyn; Fixing Up A Fixer-Upper

body: A State Supreme Court justice in Manhattan ruled on Wednesday that children who attend public school in New York City are illegally deprived of a sound education, and ordered the state to increase funding for city schools. So what do the children themselves think of their schools? And how would they spend any extra money? The New York Times asked
title: Less Yellow and Blue Paint, More Books and Computers

body: Four people returning from a New Year's Day party were killed early yesterday when their speeding car struck a City Sanitation Department front-loader clearing snow from the weekend storm, officials said. The police said two men and two women in a 1993 Dodge Intrepid were killed when their car exploded in flames along a residential stretch of Bay
title: Four Killed as Car Strikes a Front-Loader Clearing Snow
